name: Andaz West Hollywood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed over a weekend at the Andaz and it was overall a very good experience. This is basically Hyatt's version of the W hotel chain.
reviews.title: Probably the best hotel in West Hollywood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Pros
reviews.title: Sunset strip swanky

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: - Valet service was excellent. You pay a pretty hefty fee (I think it's around 35-40/night if memory serves) but they do get your car quickly and are very friendly.
reviews.title: Great four star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011
reviews.text: - Front desk staff. Ok, there isn't a front desk. And there aren't really any uniforms either, just some hip young people carrying around tablet pcs. Everyone was helpful and check in was smooth.
reviews.title: Plush...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: - Restaurant - we had breakfast in the main restaurant and everything was great. Typicially over priced for a full service hotel but at least everything was good and the service equally good.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for only 3 nights whilst on a two week honeymoon, we were spliting our time between 3 different states and after a particularly disappointing hotel in Hawaii we spent the entire flight worried about what our travel agent had booked for us next. We couldn't have more happy to arive at the Andaz to be greeted with a very warm welcome and complimentary glass of wine.
reviews.title: Just Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had only a standard room overlooking the hollywood hils and the houses of the rich and famous but it had everything we needed and more, the beds are amazingly comfortable (and HUGE), the food was amazing, the location was brilliant, you can get the bus or cab the 1.5 miles to the walk of fame but we chose to walk, we also booked other tours including one to Santa Monica Pier you can do this through the Concierge but it may pay to book before you travel as you might save money.
reviews.title: Cool and laid back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area though small was a relaxing retreat away from the hustle and bustle of the LA streest below.
reviews.title: Takes service to a whole new level

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing Hotel, Amazing staff, Amazing stay we will definitely be back, I would recommend this Hotel to anyone,
reviews.title: what an amazing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a long memorial weekend at the Andaz and were very happy. The location is very good and close to restaurants and night clubs. It’s really cool that they have lap tops in the lobby, so you can stay on top of life back home, if need be. I was a little disappointed w/ the roof top pool. Very small and closes around 9P.M. We stayed on the PH floor and had a great view of the SunSet Strip and L.A. I would highly suggest that on your first day, you take the Hop on Hop off , double Decker bus (no Roof) for $25. One of the stops, is right in front of the hotel, and will take you to Rodeo Drive and other shopping areas and tourist attractions. For $35, the bus will take you to the Santa Monica pier, Brentwood, 3rd St. promenade (worth the trip). This way you will get a chance to see where places are located and your ticket is good for 24hrs. (Highly Suggest). We also did the “Home of the Stars”tour. I would suggest going w/ a tour company that doesn’t have a roof on their vehicle, because most of the time you’re looking up and will miss most of the good sights!!!! (approx $50 per person)
reviews.title: Decent, only good if you pay extra to get a room with a view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There´s no Lobby in the Hotel, only a Lounge with the people making the usual Hotel stuff!The check inn was very quick and the complimentary mini-bar a nice surprise.
reviews.title: Nice and unusual modern Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room looked the Hills and was very quiet indeed. The Hotel´s locatios is wonderful, but a cal in LA is really a necessity! The vallet parking is expensive and you get charged for the 24 hours even if your car is the whole day out! We ordered room-service and the burguer was very good but too expensive!
reviews.title: Service wins

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The pool was very beautiful, with nice Cabanas, chill out music. It really shouldn´t be allowed to smoke there!
reviews.title: Great lobby, rooms not so much...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Fitness center was very well equipped and clean. And also 24hour!
reviews.title: Andaz concept is a good one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Our room was nice, but there were nothing special. I didn´t like the bathroom. The sink is too small, there´s no place to put women´s stuff and there´s nothing to prevent the water from passinh through the hole place! A bit messy!
reviews.title: Love that Vibe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights in October 2010 at the start of our honeymoon. Can't believe we've forgotten to write a review! This would have to be our favourite place we've ever stayed at. The location & quality = unbeatable. Would have loved to have stayed longer. Rooftop pool was fantastic for relaxing at the end of a busy day of sightseeing. Felt like a celebrity! Hoping to return to the States May/June next year & Andaz will be our first choice by far!!
reviews.title: Unbeatable!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved every minute of our stay at the Andaz West Hollywood, from check in to check out the staff were friendly and helpful, offering everything and more that I would expect from a top class hotel. From the second we walked into the property we were offered drinks and were accomodated perfectly. Lauren was wonderful :)
reviews.title: Excellent - Best Hotel During 5 Week Trip to the USA
Looking Tired; Stingy With Hyatt Diamond Status Upgrades
reviews.text: Soft drinks & snacks are free in the room - a lovely touch at 3 in the morning when you just need a drink of water and don't want to shell out $7 for a bottle from the minibar. The tv overlooking the sunset strip view is a cool idea and great to take in what is going on in the street below.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location, in the heart of the Sunset Strip and could walk everywhere to bars & restaurants. Those getting the tourist hop on hop off bus will be glad to know there is a stop right next door. No noise from the street below, even with the vents open it was fine and didnt affect sleep quality.
reviews.title: loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The view from the pool is fabulous, and the cocktails are excellent. Loved the cabana beds to take in the afternoon sun with a few Mojitos.
reviews.title: Second stay--still great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Andaz have there service spot on in West Hollywood. They were so helpful in a relaxed natural approach the was not contrived or superficial.
reviews.title: Hip Hotel , Great Location, Awesome Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Contemporary rooms had great views. The locations is perfect for the Hollywood attractions and the great bars and restaurants on nearby Santa Monica Blvd.
reviews.title: Everything you read is true...Fantastic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011
reviews.text: we will stay again
reviews.title: Excellent place for a weekend break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: the bed or from my lounging area tv which overlooked Sunset Boulevarde. Felt very spoilt. Oh, plus you get complimentary mini bar snacks and drinks daily (not the boozy kind, but hey, lets not be greedy). This is on top of the complimentary snacks, drinks, fruit, pastries, tea/coffee they have available 24/7 in the lobby. The bathroom was very good. Big shower, great toiletries. The staff, all of them, very friendly and polite. Great bar, even came away with a new drink out of it! If only I could remember it... Loved the pool area with the cabanas, not a huge area, but with that view, it doesn't matter. It would a fantastic place to have a party..My stay was back in September of this year, but didn't want it be over hence only writing about it now. Would definitely stayt at the Andaz West Hollywood again. Hopefully soon....
reviews.title: Fantastic accomodations & staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011
reviews.text: Loved the vibe in this hotel. Friendly, welcoming staff on arrival. I liked the less formal check-in using an iPad. Rooftop pool was fun, rooms nice and clean. Room service was good and the free soft drinks and snacks a bonus. I'd definitely go back.
reviews.title: Yes it's true they have a complimentary mini bar!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent four nights here in May. Check-in was a breeze. The room was clean and comfortable. They have a lovely rooftop pool with spectacular view. The on-site restaurant was charming with excellent service and good food. Parking is mandatory valet for $32 per night. (Not any more than self-parking at most other area hotels.) We just had to call down and they would have our car waiting for us by the time we got outside. Everyone who works at this hotel provides prompt, friendly and courteous service. We had a lovely stay.
reviews.title: Nice little hotel on Sunset Strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located on the heart of Sunset Blvd. of Hollywood. The staff was very cordial and informative, the views and Cabana bar\pool were amazing. Just what you would expect Hollywood to be. A real fun place to be for a few days. Maybe a little bit dark in the hallways?
reviews.title: Hollywood Central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff were excellent from arranging an early check in to looking after all of our needs. If you need to go to L.A. this is a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: My suite in this hotel was clearly a party pad. It's located across the road from the House of Blues and right beside the Comedy Club on the Sunset Strip. And it was decked out.
reviews.title: Rock 'n' roll hotel on the Sunset Strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Seriously, it was way too fancy for lil' ol' me. The main room had a bar with a chandelier above it. There were big screen TVs in the main room and the bedroom. There was a corner couch and plenty of seats. And -- the best part -- there was a glass-walled sitting room that looked over the strip and out to the hills. Oh, and a tiny TV in the corner of that sitting room. Ah-mazing.
reviews.title: Just ok...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at the Andaz West Hollywood from 2-5 November. The open-plan lobby with no defined reception or identifiable staff does not work and, while it understood that staff will soon wear uniforms, there was general confusion about how to check in, check out or make enquiries. The room itself was generously sized and we had a fantastic view of LA from the enclosed balcony, although we paid extra for the privilege. Wifi was complementary, reliable and reasonably fast. Items in the mini-bar (minus the alcohol) were also complementary. Overnight parking fees ($32 a night for guests and non-guests alike) seemed very unreasonable.
reviews.title: Very West Hollywood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We received great service from the moment we walked through the door into the "reception" area. We were seated on the comfortable couches and offered a glass of wine while we were checked in on an ipad. The reception area/lounge looks great and they provide free drinks and snacks during the day and complimentary wine between about 5-7pm.
reviews.title: Great hotel with excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room has a free mini bar (apart from beer and spirits) and is well stocked with a good selection of non-alc drinks and snacks, including some reasonably healthy selections.
reviews.title: Nice, but not going there again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: We stayed in a room facing Sunset Blvd, which are large with a enclosed sunroom where the balcony used to be. This has a separate tv and makes the room seem much larger. It is a great use of space. The view from the room extends to the city and the sunrise is great if you are up late/early.
reviews.title: ANDAZ is ANDAWESOME!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also ate at RH restaurant one night and it was really good, although relatively quiet in terms of people next to the crowded hotel bar on a Wednesday night.
reviews.title: Great Property in central West Hollywood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I travel to LA frequently and usually stay in WeHo. As a hyatt plat member, I wanted to give the Andaz a shot (usually stay at the London WeHo). While the renovation/rebranding was well done, my partner and I had some material flaws.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great staff...some flaws

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the positive side, the free snacks/beverages were a nice tough, the rooms were large and comfortable and the staff was accommodating. The gym was nicer than the London's.
reviews.title: very chic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We paid for an upgraded room (corner suite) on a high floor. We enjoyed the separate bedroom and 2 bathrooms. However, the quality of the bathrooms was shocking. They were incredibly tiny. I don't understand how a high-end hotel, could get away with this (let alone a suite). You could fit the most basic room at the London's shower into the entire bathroom. The shower head was basically a worthless waterpick. You can't shower without getting water everywhere. There are no baths. Don't even think about getting more than 1 person in the bathroom at a time.
reviews.title: Modern Gem In Old W. Hollywood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another issue we had was street noise. They need to invest in some double-paned windows. I don't mean noise from neighboring rooms, but rather they can't even block car noise out of a 10th floor room.
reviews.title: Different from other hotels and good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Other minor beefs - shades don't blackout the room and room service was lacking. The menu, especially breakfast, is incredibly limited and highly overpriced.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, reasonable price, Great Location!

description: On Sunset Strip, directly across from House of Blues. Central to Santa Monica Blvd, Pacific Design Center, Hollywood Blvd., Rodeo Drive, the Walk of Fame, Grauman's/Mann's Chinese Theater, and the Kodak Theater - Home to the Oscars. Minutes from the Getty Center, Universal, Paramount and MGM Studios. 12 miles to Los Angeles International Airport and Burbank Airport. 257 guest rooms including 16 Junior Suites. Rooftop outdoor heated pool. Walking distance to restaurants and shopping.
